Package DBAccess

Class DBQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • DBAccess.DBQuery
  • public class DBQuery
extends java.lang.Object
    The DBQuery Class. This class is responsible for handling query statements between the java application and the MySQL database. I have included methods for both statements and prepared statements.

    • Method Detail

      • setStatement

        public static void setStatement​(java.sql.Connection conn)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        The setStatement() method. This takes a parameter of the Connection class called conn and calls a createStatement() method.
        Parameters:
        conn - The connection object created in the DBConnect class.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getStatement

        public static java.sql.Statement getStatement()
        The getStatement() method. This method is called to get the statement object created in the set statement method.

      • setPreparedStatement

        public static void setPreparedStatement​(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                        java.lang.String sqlStatement)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        The setPreparedStatement() method. This method is used to create a prepared statement object and will accept two parameters. One being a connection object and the other a string where a SQL statement will be passed.
        Parameters:
        conn - The connection object passed to the method
        sqlStatement - The sqlStatement that is passed is a String that will have a functioning SQL statement.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getPreparedStatement

        public static java.sql.PreparedStatement getPreparedStatement()
        The getPreparedStatement() method. This method will be the one responsible for getting the statement object that was created in the setPreparedStatement() method.
